Posts.Content: I was diagnosed with DCIS with micro invasion and 2 weeks ago had a WLE and SLNB. Unfortunately my results showed that the surgeon did not get a clear margin and I will get further surgery on 18 February. Coupled to this I was told that two nodes were removed which showed micromets. I was advised that I would get radiotherapy to my underarm also now and for a longer period than first discussed. I will also get medication. Hearing hat the cancer spread to my nodes is really worrying me. Has anyone had a similar experience.
Posts.Title: Micromets

Posts.Content: Hi Janet I am also from Glasgow. I had two lumpectomies and a sentinel node biopsy but now I need a mastectomy and node clearance. I am waiting for the date to have it done. I would love to meet up with other ladies. Kathleen
Posts.Title: Any Scottish ladies out there?

Posts.Content: Hi Dorothee Yes, I am on Facebook. I was trying to pm you here but not sure how to send a friend request which you need to first I think!
Posts.Title: Any Scottish ladies out there?

Posts.Content: Hi Bevs Of course I would be happy to chat. Let me know the best way to contact you x
Posts.Title: Have you had re-constructive surgery?

Posts.Content: Hi there. I had a mastectomy in April with LD reconstructive surgery. As my breasts were quite large and a bit droopy, I was offered a lift/reduction on my other side which I had carried out at the same time. I am delighted with the outcome of my surgery as my breasts are the same size and it does make it easier to get fitting bras! I have healed very well and have got to say that I prefer my shape now and would therefore recommend it. Hope this helps. X
Posts.Title: Have you had re-constructive surgery?

Posts.Content: Hi everyone. I have been on Letrozole for 3 weeks now and being driven crazy with terrible itchy crawling skin. I am on no other medication. Can anyone advice me on how to relieve this. Thanks x
Posts.Title: Side effects of Letrozole

Posts.Content: Thanks Kate. I will do that x
